io.ddf.content

Class APersistenceHandler.APersistible

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.ddf.types.AGloballyAddressable
      • io.ddf.content.APersistenceHandler.APersistible
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IHandlePersistence.IPersistible, ISerializable, IGloballyAddressable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PersistenceHandler.BasicPersistible
    Enclosing class:
    APersistenceHandler

    public abstract static class APersistenceHandler.APersistible
extends AGloballyAddressable
implements IGloballyAddressable, IHandlePersistence.IPersistible
    Base class for objects that can persist themselves, via the DDF persistence mechanism
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • afterDeserialization

        public ISerializable afterDeserialization(ISerializable deserializedObject,
                                 Object serializationData)
                                   throws DDFException
        Description copied from interface: ISerializable
        Note this signature returns an ISerializable, which will be the ultimate object being returned from deserialization. This means the object can take over at this point and return a different object instead. We use this, for instance, as a trick in BasicDDF, to return the embedded object, instead of the container DDF itself.
        Specified by:
        afterDeserialization in interface ISerializable
        Returns:
        Throws:
        DDFException
